statement.title: Content
statement.content: Bob and Alice are playing a new game. There are $n$ boxes which have been numbered from $1$ to $n$. Each box is either empty or contains several cards. Bob and Alice move the cards in turn. In each turn the corresponding player should choose a non-empty box $A$ and choose another box $B$ that $B<A$ and $A+B\pmod{2}=1$ and $A+B\pmod{3}=0$. Then, take an arbitrary number (but not zero) of cards from box $A$ to box $B$. The last one who can do a legal move wins. Alice is the first player. Please predict who will win the game.

statement.title: Standard Input
statement.content: The first line contains an integer $T$ ($T\leq 100$) indicating the number of test cases. The first line of each test case contains an integer $n$ ($1\leq n\leq 10000$). The second line has $n$ integers which will not be bigger than $100$. The $i\_{th}$ integer indicates the number of cards in the $i\_{th}$ box.

statement.title: Standard Output
statement.content: For each test case, print the case number and the winner's name in a single line. Follow the format of the sample output.

statement.title: Samples
statement.content:
Input Output
2 2 1 2 7 1 3 3 2 2 1 2Case 1: Alice Case 2: Bob
